result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan Scott Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Scott Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan Scott Smith in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for jury trial.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to County ordinance section 63.01, a Class forfeiture.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $125.00 including costs to be paid by 12-21-2015 or Civil Judgment.

Defendant Alan Scott Smith in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Final pre-trial conference held. Case remains calendared for jury trial on June 24, 2015 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 37.
-Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions from Attorney Adam Essling on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Alan Scott Smith in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Pretrial conference held. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Breanna T.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alan Scott Smith in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
